name: Delicious and Nutritious Whole Wheat Banana and Blueberry Muffins
author: debbie eckstein
summary: Chock-full of sweet ripened bananas and juicy blueberries. These muffins are great for a midday snack or as part of your breakfast. Made with whole wheat flour and sweetened with pure maple syrup, these moist muffins are delicious, nutritious, and deeply satisfying!
ingredients: ¼ cup coconut oil, melted and cooled
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Blend flour, baking soda, salt, and baking powder together in a bowl
Make a well in the center; add eggs, maple syrup, applesauce, and coconut oil
Stir by hand until just combined
Divide batter evenly into the prepared muffin tin
Bake in the preheated oven, 6 to 7 minutes
Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Continue baking until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, about 15 minutes more
Cool muffins in tin for 5 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack to cool completely
